item.title: Flytipped 3 items on Land fronting dry cleaners, 226, Venner Rd, Penge on the corner with Newlands Parade, 10th September
item.description:
Flytipped 3 items on Land fronting dry cleaners, 226, Venner Rd, Penge on the corner with Newlands Parade. I do not know whether this is Council footway land or shop frontage. A green textile recycling bank is also here. The flytip comprises - a white piece of mdf furniture (maybe shelf unit) about 1m x 0.75m x 0.75m - a chair frame - and outdoor folding metal small chair frame
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 210, Venner Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover has trip hazard sticking up, 10th September
item.description:
There is a small item sticking out of the hole cover as shown in the photo which I tripped over, sustaining minor injuries. I am concerned this could cause serious injury to others as it is not very visible. I tried pushing it down into the hole but it pops back up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanstead Road, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bowls recruitment vinyl banner, about 2m x 0.75m cable-tied to pedestrian guard railing on the council narrow footway between Village Way and Beckenham Recreation Ground., 10th September
item.description:
Bowls recruitment vinyl banner, about 2m x 0.75m cable-tied to pedestrian guard railing on the council narrow footway between Village Way and Beckenham Recreation Ground. This guard railing is outside of and not part of the park. This is near the ramp up to the Council Village Way multistorey car park. Bromley Council does not permit advertisements on its pedestrian guard railings.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Village Way, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Centre of Fraser road sinking, 10th September
item.description:
The centre of the road on Fraser Road is sinking down, causing vehicles to pull to the side or scrape along the surface of the road. It also causes larger vehicles such as buses to have to serve to avoid the hole and avoid grounding out. It has been getting deeper and deeper over time and needs repairing before it gives way.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fraser Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lighting, 10th September
item.description:
Street Light outside 33 Hayesford Park Drive, comes On & Off randomly during both Evening & during Night. Also, area very dark because of tree in garden blocking light from street light near number 39. Been problem for many weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayesford Park Drive, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trailer left and unmoved for weeks, 10th September
item.description:
Trailer left, possibly abandoned in the road for over 2 months. This road has permit parking - is a permit paid for this "vehicle" given it does not have a number plate? It should be off road parked or stored somewhere else. It is blocking natural light in to a number of houses, is taking up multiple parking spaces and is not being used. Please can this be investigated urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cliffview Road, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
